Is it safe/correct to have OSX_TEMP_ISO here even though it's not a thing for non-OSX? It is unconditionally assigned a value on line 38.
diff_hunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ if ENABLE_MAN
 SUBDIRS += doc/man
 endif
 .PHONY: deploy FORCE
+.INTERMEDIATE: $(OSX_TEMP_ISO) $(COVERAGE_INFO)

[`8a0c986f6840886d...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/f1dbf92ff0475a01d20170ea422c1d086acbbc57/guix_build.log) | [`9c539051550f2d22...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/aba1aad34b1f82f8d5a7c28d2ec79d9e85b77e8b/guix_build.log) | | guix_build.log.diff | | [`366ffc6130c23620...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/aba1aad34b1f82f8d5a7c28d2ec79d9e85b77e8b/guix_build.log.diff) |

> Is it safe/correct to have OSX_TEMP_ISO here even though it's not a thing for non-OSX?

"OSX_TEMP_ISO ... [i]s not a thing for non-OSX" seems like a bit vague statement for the next reasons:
1) Being a global variable, the `OSX_TEMP_ISO` is defined regardless of the place of its evaluation, i.e., on all platforms:
```
$ make print-OSX_TEMP_ISO
OSX_TEMP_ISO = Bitcoin-Core.temp.iso
```

2) On macOS, when `BUILD_DARWIN` is set to `true`, the resulted `Makefile` has no the `Bitcoin-Core.temp.iso` target. So one of prerequisites of the `.INTERMEDIATE` target has no recipe of its own. `make` is aware of such possible conditions (e.g., https://www.gnu.org/software/make/manual/html_node/Last-Resort.html)

3) Being a special target, the `.INTERMEDIATE` just explicitly [marks](https://www.gnu.org/software/make/manual/html_node/Chained-Rules.html) its each prerequisite file as intermediate, regardless if the file is mentioned explicitly in some other way
diff_hunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ if ENABLE_MAN
 SUBDIRS += doc/man
 endif
 .PHONY: deploy FORCE
+.INTERMEDIATE: $(OSX_TEMP_ISO) $(COVERAGE_INFO)

body:
Yes I was a bit unclear there, sorry.
I wondered if it might have been better to define `OSX_TEMP_ISO` as empty on non-DARWIN, instead of assign it a value, so that it's not included in `.INTERMEDIATES`.
But it is good to know that adding it to  `.INTERMEDIATES` cannot actually trigger the build rule. I guess that addresses my concern.
diff_hunk:
@@ -12,6 +12,7 @@ if ENABLE_MAN
 SUBDIRS += doc/man
 endif
 .PHONY: deploy FORCE
+.INTERMEDIATE: $(OSX_TEMP_ISO) $(COVERAGE_INFO)

body:
Tested and very light review ACK 5e0dedb111ed9db03914b9dac36cf081974c2918

IDK if there is a better solution but I've been recompiling several times a day with this patch while testing pulls and it resolves the warning while working fine for me.
